Instrument.name: The Optical, Spectroscopic, and Infrared Remote Imaging System (OSIRIS) Wide Angle Camera (WAC) for the Rosetta Orbiter
Instrument.description: The Optical, Spectroscopic, and Infrared Remote Imaging System (OSIRIS) is the primary imaging system on the Rosetta spacecraft. The Wide Angle Camera (WAC) was constructed with an off-axis two mirror system to direct the light beam, a double filter wheel, a mechanical shutter, an antiradiation plate, and a CCD detector. Unlike the NAC, the WAC filter wheels do not include any refocusing plates, but instead have empty filter slots in each wheel to be used when a filter in the other wheel was engaged. Filters available in the WAC ranged in coverage from 246.2 nm to 629.8 nm. The field of view was 11.34 x 12.11 degrees.
